alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 18 at 6:49AM EST until December 18 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Rain and Snowmelt in... Southern Franklin County in western Maine... Central Oxford County in western Maine... * Until 200 PM EST Monday. * At 649 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Rapid snowmelt is also occurring and will add to the flooding. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain and rapid snowmelt. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Frozen soils will cause rapid runoff produced by rainfall and snowmelt. The area small streams are expected to rise rapidly this morning and flood area roads. Significant rises are possible which could threaten properties in flood prone areas. Travel disruptions will increase throughout the day. The excessive runoff could cause road washouts, especially in the Western Maine Mountains and foothills. Streams of particular concern are the Sandy River and the Carrabasset River. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Farmington, Bethel, Rumford, Jay, Madrid, Phillips, Avon, Strong, Dixfield, Kingfield, Canton, Andover and Carrabassett Valley. This includes the following Rec locations... Saddleback Mountain, Sugarloaf Mountain, Mount Abraham, Grafton Notch, Evans Notch, and Mount Blue. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
